intro: Sinningia globulosa, commonly known as the wax plant, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including red, pink, and white, and are often used in horticultural displays. Sinningia globulosa prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening.
